# Currently:
Our data management has no clear plan. 
This results is a mess of files, hard-drives, and headaches.\
Click down to see the current situtation:

## {auto-animate="true" auto-animate-duration=".25"}
A project gets set-up with variable formats.\
The variable project names create tracking issues

:::{data-id='cur01' .imgDiv}
![](./media/curr_state_01.png)
:::

## {auto-animate="true" auto-animate-duration=".25"}
Raw data are then collected by the UVP.\
These get stored on the local computer

:::{data-id='cur01' class='imgDiv' .r-stretch}
![](./media/curr_state_02.png)
:::

## {auto-animate="true" auto-animate-duration=".25"}
Then, raw data are backed-up to a local harddrive.\
Data are also transferred to USC-computer

:::{data-id='cur01' class='imgDiv' .r-stretch}
![](./media/curr_state_03.png)
:::

## {auto-animate="true" auto-animate-duration=".25"}
From here, data again backed-up to harddrives.\
From one of these, they are transfered to processing

:::{data-id='cur01' class='imgDiv' .r-stretch}
![](./media/curr_state_05.png)
:::

## {auto-animate="true" auto-animate-duration=".25"}
Processing will create new files for meta-data\
There are corresponding vignettes and particle data too.

:::{data-id='cur01' class='imgDiv' .r-stretch}
![](./media/curr_state_07.png)
:::

## {auto-animate="true" auto-animate-duration=".25"}
However, the pathway to processing is not consistent\
This results in messy storage of partial projects

:::{data-id='cur01' class='imgDiv' .r-stretch}
![](./media/curr_state_10.png)
:::

## {auto-animate="true" auto-animate-duration=".25"}
Regardless of transfer pathway, once processed, data are sent
to the LoV server

:::{data-id='cur01' class='imgDiv' .r-stretch}
![](./media/curr_state_11.png)
:::

## {auto-animate="true" auto-animate-duration=".25"}
Importing the data to Ecotaxa and Ecopart creates 
two connected-projects.

:::{data-id='cur01' class='imgDiv' .r-stretch}
![](./media/curr_state_12.png)
:::

## {auto-animate="true" auto-animate-duration=".25"}
In Ecotaxa, vignettes are sorted and validated.\
Once validated, zooplankton data are available in Ecopart.

:::{data-id='cur01' class='imgDiv' .r-stretch}
![](./media/curr_state_13.png)
:::

## {auto-animate="true" auto-animate-duration=".25"}
Ecopart export then provided processed data for analysis.\
However, we don't have a clear file storage system.

:::{data-id='cur01' class='imgDiv' .r-stretch}
![](./media/curr_state_14.png)
:::

# A New Path:
By laying out a standard operating procedure for our data management,
we can create a robust, easy-to-follow system. This will allow us to
spend less time checking back over old notes, less time explaining work flows
to new students, and more time studying ecology!\
Click down to see the plan:
